channel.title: 317 Item adding help please!
channel.description: hey so i downloaded some custom items and i put the gz/dat file in the right spot.....edited the class8 correctly....edited the item list correctly.....and the when i go to spawn it,its either null or some really weird item, also its always in the form of a weapon. Like if i add a cape and spawn and equip it then its in the weapon spot. Also ill open it in model viewer and it looks just like the item it says it is. So how do i go about fixing this, please help....Thanks

item.title: 317 Item adding help please!
item.dc:creator: @naughty_jef naughty jef
item.description:
@naughty_jef wrote:

changing the weilding spot is in the actual model it’s self it has a position that it is when you weild it and that is decided when you make the model in say metaseq they add a rs npc model and put it in the hand to determine where the model will be when you weild it. so you have to make the model again pretty much or move it if you have the origional model not the .gz file.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Item adding help please!
item.dc:creator: @iamapker iamapker
item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

ok first of all. move the .gz into the models folder, then run the client and log in and type add model (and the number before the .gz file) so if the model was 7777.gz then in client type “add model 7777” without the “” or ::add model 7777 it should say succesully added, if it doesnt say anything then just log out close client, add the ints in class.8 java and give the item an item ID so lets say you give the item id like 2412 then close save compile the client and run it again, log in and do ::pickup 2412 or ::item 2412 whatever spawns items in your server, if you did it right, the item will come up with its correct graphics, but it will still go to the weapon slot. once you get the item to apear the way you want, post back and ill explain how to make it go to its right wielding spot

Read full topic
